name: Download data from NCAR EarthCube CHORDS
description: URL based API to access data from real time instruments and sensors; A specification for the API could not be found, but examples at the documentation link above can be reverse engineers without too much trouble. This document describes a particular service instance

potentialAction.name: Download Multiple Instrument Data: all instruments
potentialAction.description: Download all instruments for past 24 hours.

result.description: for better interoperability and targeting software applications, need a more granular specification of the encoding that defines the JSON key vocabulary and semantics, vocabularies used to populate property values, and conventions for syntax.

target.documentation: #supported mime type of response; implication is that this would be use in http header?

urlTemplate-input.description: The encoding format of the data

object.description: what would be useful here is a listing of the instruments that support the feed, and the variables measured.

variableMeasured.name: name of the variable
variableMeasured.description: example of documentation for a varible provided in the result.dataDownload
variableMeasured.propertyID: URI for the property in some ontology
variableMeasured.measurementTechnique: URI for the measurement protocol, or text description of procedure and sensor

potentialAction.name: Get data acquired from multiple instruments for date range
potentialAction.description: Download multiple instruments w/ instrument ids bounded by an optional start and/or end date

urlTemplate-input.description: A comma-separated list of instrument identifiers. Instrument identifiers for this end point are integers between 1 and 6
A start time for the returned measurements. use xsd:dateTime format
An end time for the returned measurements. use xsd:dateTime format

object.description: need to clarify the purpose of having these '-input' elements here is; see object is last entry above, where suggest that should describe the variableMeasured that are reported by the DataFeed. Also the identifier-input values are instrument identifiers, not identifiers for the DataFeed, seems like this would be confusing; and the temporalCoverage input is not consistent with 'a textual string indicating a time period in ISO 8601 time interval format.'

potentialAction.name: Download Single Instrument Data
potentialAction.description: data from a single instrument in an optional start and/or end date

result.description: for better interoperability and targeting software applications, need a more granular specification of the encoding that defines the JSON key vocabulary and semantics, vocabularies used to populate property values, and conventions for syntax.

urlTemplate-input.description: The encoding format of the data

Its not clear how to deal with the valueName parameter-- is a flag with no value, and invalidates other parameters (start, end) if present?  its and optional property, if used, start and end are ignored. Simply include the parameter with no value to indicate that the most recent value(s) from the instrument should be reported
